name: Scarecrow
lore: Crafted from cast-off materials and animated through sinister magic, scarecrows are given a semblance of life by malevolent forcesâ€”often by hags, fiends, or dark spellcasters. Though they appear to be mundane objects standing in lonely fields, they come alive to terrify and slay. Their straw-filled bodies and hollow faces conceal a predatory cunning, and they delight in the fear they inspire.

languages.notes: Understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.description: If the scarecrow is motionless at the start of combat, it has Advantage on its Initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the scarecrow move or act, that creature must succeed on a DC 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the scarecrow is animate.

multiattack.description: The scarecrow makes two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.description: Melee Attack Roll: +3, reach 5 ft. Hit: 6 (2d4 + 1) Slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it has the Frightened condition until the start of the scarecrow's next turn.

conditions.duration: until the start of the scarecrow's next turn

hit.additionalEffects: The Frightened condition applies only if the target is a creature.

bonusActions.name: Terrifying Gaze
bonusActions.description: The scarecrow targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of itself. The target must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw or have the Frightened condition until the end of the scarecrow's next turn. On a failed save, the target is also Paralyzed for the same duration.

savingThrow.targets: one creature the scarecrow can see within 30 feet of itself

conditions.duration: until the end of the scarecrow's next turn
until the end of the scarecrow's next turn
